title: Jane Bunn flaunts her curvy figure in a black dress on the red carpet
text:
She's the meteorologist whose flirty weather reports for Channel Seven have earned her a cult following on social media.

And on Wednesday, Jane Bunn showed off her fashion credentials on the red carpet during Caulfield Cup Carnival.

After posing by the media wall, the 40-year-old broadcaster attended a classy dinner at the Melbourne restaurant Vue de monde.

Keeping it classy! Channel Seven meteorologist Jane Bunn showed off her fashion credentials on the red carpet for Caulfield Cup Carnival on Wednesday

She flaunted her curvy figure in a form-fitting dress by Karen Millen that featured a tasteful V neckline.

The glamorous blonde accentuated her hip-to-waist ratio by wearing a Carla Zampatti belt.

Jane accessorised her look with a Stella McCartney purse and high heels from Tony Bianco.

Red carpet ready: Jane flaunted her curvy figure in a form-fitting dress by Karen Millen that featured a tasteful V neckline

Jane's latest red carpet appearance comes after she spoke about the unfortunate downside of her soaring popularity.

She told the Herald Sun that while many of her Internet fans are perfectly polite, others bombard her with lewd comments.

'I will [only] answer your question if it is clean. If it is all above board, I am very happy to answer your question, if it is not, I am not going to give you that time,' she said.

Everybody's favourite! The meteorologist's flirty weather reports for Channel Seven have earned her a cult following on social media

Jane added: 'I will literally skim comments so fast and all I am looking for is a weather question, as in has someone asked something that is legitimately about the weather that I can help with.'

She also revealed that she no longer checks Facebook before going to bed, as many of the comments left in the evening are obscene.

'I don't look at it late at night before I go to sleep,' she said. 'I put a ban on myself and when I do read them, as I said, I just skim them.'
description: She's the meteorologist whose flirty weather reports for Channel Seven have earned her a cult following on social media.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
